NeptuneFirst: ^... oh, you're still talking to me? I'm Neptune.
^Just so you know, I wouldn't associate with me.

c-0: ^ Why, is it a problem to be around you?
^I... uh, don't think things could get much worse for me.
^Just don't, okay? People don't stay by me for long.
^Well, I have no reason to go...
c-1: ^ Why, is it a problem to be around you?
^I... uh, don't think things could get much worse for me.
^Just don't, okay? People don't stay by me for long.
^Well, I have no reason to go...
c-2: ^ I uhh... don't know what to say.

see: ^Good. Then you can leave me alone.
^Could you at least hear me out?

c-0: ^ Could you... um... listen to why I'm here?
^Fine... I'll listen... just for a bit though.
c-1: ^ I suppose I can stop bothering you.
^I just wanted to talk to someone.

c-0: ^ Sorry... I just wanted to talk to someone.
^Fine. I'll listen... just for a bit though.

reasontoleave: ^I guess that explains why you're out here.
^But how do I know you wouldn't just leave me as well?
^I'm not sure how to prove that.

c-0: ^ Because I have no reason to.
c-1: ^ I can't really prove otherwise, but...
g-0: ^I really just want to find a new planet to orbit...
^You've got a lot to sort out there. But I'm not really looking for anything right now.
^Would it be alright for me to come back later?

c-2: ^ Could I uhh, possibly come back later?
c-3: ^Could I uhh, possibly come back later?

g-1: ^I mean, I guess. I'm not sure why you would want to though...
^Thank you. It was nice talking to you.

NeptuneSecond: ^Earth never listened much, so it was nice.
^It must be rough, having to leave.

c-0: ^ It was rough, but it had to be done.
^It just wasn't right, being ignored all the time.
^Yeah... it's not fair to ignore someone so close.
^Although, if that's the case, you might not want to stay near me...
c-1: ^I understand... but maybe not for the reasons you'd expect.
g-0: ^If you don't want to talk about it, that's fine.

c-3: ^ Could... you tell me about it?
^I'm not sure... you'll probably just leave like the rings.
c-4: ^ You don't have to tell me if you don't want to.
^I would... be willing to hear your story though.

c-0: ^Thank you... I'm not used to people talking to me.
^Could you tell me about yourself instead?
c-1: ^Moon leaves, feeling that Neptune doesn't want them nearby.

main: ^Well... the start of it was that I had to leave Earth.
^I just couldn't be in their orbit anymore. Year after year, only being taken for granted, and never sought after.
^I'm not sure if you noticed, but I have more than a few moons.
^I've done them wrong, and as such, they don't really want to associate with me.
^Unlike you, however, they can't leave. A lone orbit is too unstable for such small moons. I fear they would be lost in the great belt forever if they left.
^So, despite me having them here, it gets quite lonely.
^The point in this being, I am all too similar to Earth... which is why I pushed you away.

s: ^You looked lonely, so I wanted to talk.

c-1: ^But... why me? Surely there were better choices.

projects: ^They were always preocupied with their stupid projects...
^First it was the oceans, then the dinosaurs...
^You become more and more visibly shaken as you talk.
^It's okay, Moon. You don't have to explain everything to me.
^Thank you... I know that was a lot.
^I just needed to get my feelings straight.
^Moon, if you ever wanted to talk more, I'm always here, okay?
